big_picture_notes: 2 Peter is a testament‑style epistle with an A–B–A′ movement: ch. 1 establishes apostolic authority and the divine power/knowledge that grounds Christian life; ch. 2 delivers an oracle of judgment against false teachers by typology; ch. 3 resolves the challenge of the Lord’s seeming delay with an eschatological reminder and ethical summons. Literary glue: recurring ‘knowledge’ (gnōsis/epignōsis), antitheses (truth vs myths, freedom vs slavery), and typological proofs (angels, Flood, Sodom; and the Flood again in ch. 3).

stories.story_title: The Foundation of Apostolic Knowledge and Witness
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) salutation establishes authorial voice; end (1:21) climactic statement that men spoke from God, carried by the Holy Spirit. Glue: ‘knowledge’ lexeme chain, divine power/partaking of divine nature, and the tandem of eyewitness testimony + prophetic word.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Grace and knowledge greeting; divine power grants all for life/godliness; promises make partakers of the divine nature. Devices: parallelism, corruption vs escape contrast, compressed theological premise.

For this reason, make every effort to supplement faith…; ends contrasting fruitful knowledge with blindness/forgetfulness. Devices: sorites (chain virtues), epichorēgeō motif, antithesis fruitful vs useless.
Therefore be diligent to confirm calling/election; promise of rich entrance into the eternal kingdom. Devices: hortatory summary, promise/reward closure.
I intend to remind you; soon putting off my tent; write so you may recall after my departure. Devices: testament form, exodos allusion, reminder repetition.

scenes.scene_name: Eyewitness of Majesty and the Prophetic Word
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Not myths but eyewitnesses (Transfiguration); prophetic word as lamp until day dawns; prophecy from God by Holy Spirit. Devices: contrast myths/eyewitness, lamp metaphor, inspiration maxim.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:1) ‘But’ introduces false teachers; end (2:22) proverbial dog/sow verdict closes the oracle. Glue: typological enumeration (angels, Flood, Sodom; Balaam), repeated ‘destruction/judgment’ terms, and exploitation imagery.

scenes.scene_name: False Teachers Introduced and Their Fate
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Secretly bring destructive heresies, deny the Master; their judgment is not idle, destruction not asleep. Devices: antithesis, personified judgment, purchase/denial irony.

If God did not spare angels, the ancient world, Sodom—but preserved Noah and Lot—then He keeps the unrighteous for judgment. Devices: typological chain, judgment/rescue chiasm, ‘especially’ pivot to sensuality and defiance.
Despise authority, blaspheme glories; irrational creatures; revel in daytime. Devices: audacity vs angelic restraint contrast, bestial simile, retributive irony.
Blots/blemishes feasting with you; eyes full of adultery; Balaam loved gain; waterless springs, mists for whom gloom is reserved. Devices: negative metaphors, Balaam allusion, destiny image pair.
Boasts entice the barely escaping; promise freedom but are slaves; last state worse than first; dog/sow proverb closes. Devices: irony of freedom/slavery, escalation to proverbial finale.

stories.story_title: The Certainty of the End and Final Exhortation
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) second letter ‘reminder’ marks eschatological conclusion; end (3:18) benediction ‘grow in grace and knowledge’ completes inclusio. Glue: Day of the Lord refrain, divine‑time maxim, ethical ‘what sort of people’ summons.

scenes.scene_name: Reminder Purpose and Rise of Scoffers
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Stir sincere mind by reminder; scoffers ask ‘Where is the promise of his coming?’ Devices: appeal to prophets/apostles, direct quotation of challenge.
They deliberately overlook creation and Flood; by the same word the present heavens/earth kept for fire unto judgment. Devices: typological precedent, willful forgetfulness vs divine decree.
With the Lord a day as a thousand years; not wishing any to perish; Day comes like a thief, elements dissolved. Devices: time maxim, patience‑as‑salvation, thief simile.

scenes.scene_name: Holy Living While Looking for the Day
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Since all dissolves, what sort should you be? Looking for and hastening the Day; be diligent to be found spotless, at peace. Devices: hortatory question, twin ‘looking for’ refrain, ethical telos.

scenes.scene_name: Paul’s Letters, Final Warning, and Doxology
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Count patience as salvation, as Paul wrote; beware lest carried away; but grow in grace and knowledge; doxology. Devices: appeal to apostolic authority, paired warning/command, inclusio with knowledge.
